page.title: 18CLUBS IN THE KINNEFF AREA
page.content: The{KINNEFF BOWLING CLUB}meets every Tuesday night during the winter months in the village hall. There are approximately 15 members,both male and female. The club has been running for over 20 years. Club members compete each week for points. The person with the most points at the end of the year wins the league shield. Inter_Club matches are held with the Fordoun and Drumlithie Bowling Clubs. The W.R.I. or{WOMEN'S RURAL INSTITUTE is a club for women held on the third Wednesday of every month in Kinneff hall. They hold competitions and award the winners points. The woman with the most at the end of the year wins a cup. The Kinneff W.R.I was founded in 1928. At the club the women do craftwork and some times have demonstrations. Each meeting lasts about three and a half hours.
